keyTakeAways: A former New York prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility and died from injuries including internal bleeding and organ damage.
David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter; Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder and first-degree manslaughter.

The body-camera footage of the beating, though silent, showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, with no apparent concern, sparking national outrage and highlighting systemic issues in prison oversight.
William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, argued that the guards acted as a gang and collectively showed a depraved indifference to human life, which supports murder charges.
The case is part of a larger pattern of abuse, with another inmate, Messiah Nantwi, being beaten to death at a nearby prison in March 2025, leading to a separate investigation and indictment.

Six of the 10 guards indicted were charged with murder or manslaughter; five previously pleaded guilty to manslaughter, one pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor, and three are cooperating or pleading to reduced charges.
Attorneys for the accused argued that individual guards should not be held responsible for the actions of others, emphasizing the complexity of group misconduct in institutional settings.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the death of inmate Robert Brooks, who was beaten upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The body-camera footage, which showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, sparked national outrage and revealed a pattern of dehumanizing conduct. While Kingsley was convicted, guards Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, despite their involvement in the beating. The case is part of a broader investigation into systemic abuse in New York’s correctional system, including a similar incident involving inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility, which is also being prosecuted by special prosecutor William Fitzpatrick. Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representing officers in civil lawsuits, and multiple guards have either pleaded guilty or agreed to reduced charges, indicating a wider pattern of misconduct in prison operations.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
